page.title: 10EDUCATION - Schools
page.content: EDUCATION - Schools In Peacehaven the population is growing so rapidly that the three schools, Hoddern Junior, Peacehaven Infants and Telscombe Cliffs Primary are having to take in more pupils, so are gradually having less and less room in the schools. Therefore it has been decided that a fourth school will be built next year, 1986, to take on the extra number of children who are living in Peacehaven. The number of children going to the three schools is 1050. There are 290 children in Hoddern Junior School which is on Hoddern Avenue. 240 children go to Peacehaven Infants School on Roderick Avenue. Telscombe Cliffs Primary School on Telscombe Cliffs Way has a number of 520 children. The fourth school - Primary - will be built to hold approximately 240 children.
